The ultra-rich are claiming an increasing share of global wealth, report shows
subhed: The wealth of the ultra-rich is undergoing a historic surge. This is the key takeaway of the third major report of the World Inequality Lab co-directed by French economist Thomas Piketty, which emphasizes how political choices can reverse these trends.

French social security budget bill passes first step in  Assemblée Nationale
subhed: The Assemblée backed the measure, which includes the suspension of an unpopular pension reform, by 247 votes to 234 on Tuesday. It will now head back to the Sénat before returning to the lower chamber.

title: Trapped by old treaties with Russia, Europeans face threat of heavy financial penalties
subhed: A new report warns of the significant risk facing the European Union due to arbitration proceedings launched by Russian oligarchs and companies targeted by sanctions.

title: Two Paris concerts rally support and raise funds for Palestine
subhed: Two concerts in the French capital raised funds for Gaza on Tuesday: one at the Zénith venue, spearheaded by Yann Tiersen, Pomme and Aloïse Sauvage, and the other at La Flèche d'Or, under the direction of Rallye.

subhed: Skeptical of the American peace plan for Ukraine, which aligns with Moscow's wishes and from which they have been excluded, European officials have chosen a muted response toward the US.

title: Illegal crosses in French public spaces reignite debates over church-state separation
subhed: Calvaries installed on public land in towns in the Alps, on the Mediterranean coast and on the island of Corsica, sometimes with the help of far-right identitarian movements, have rekindled long-standing tensions around France's 1905 law separating churches and state.

title: President Nicusor Dan: 'In Romania, we do not have a real policy to defend against disinformation'
byline: Interview by Jean-Baptiste Chastand (Bucharest (Romania) special correspondent) and Marine Leduc
subhed: Romania borders Ukraine and is at the front line against Russian interference, which led to the cancellation of the presidential election a year ago. In an interview with Le Monde, President Nicusor Dan, elected in May, revisits the matter and discusses the differences between Europe and the US regarding the war in Ukraine.
